intro: Gnaphalium adoense, commonly known as the slender everlasting flower, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. It is typically found in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Gnaphalium adoense is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and resilience in arid conditions.
